taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek psilo- , bare, and strophe , turn; perhaps alluding to epaleate receptacles, which differ from paleate receptacles in Parthenium , to which de Candolle compared Psilostrophe ]

bio:treatment.discussion: My treatment of psilostrophes closely follows that by R. C. Brown (1978). Psilostrophe mexicana R. C. Brown is known from Chihuahua and Durango.

references.reference: Brown, R. C. 1978. Biosystematics of Psilostrophe (Compositae: Helenieae). II. Artificial hybridization and systematic treatment. Madroño 25: 187–201.

key_statement.description: Subshrubs or shrubs; stems pannose (white); heads borne singly; peduncles 35–60(–80+) mm.
Biennials or perennials; stems arachno-villous (gray to gray-green) or strigillose (greenish); heads in corymbiform arrays; peduncles 0.5–25(–50) mm.
Stems ± strigillose, (greenish, sometimes ± villous in proximal axils); ray laminaereflexed in fruit
Stems mostly arachno-villous (gray to gray-green); ray laminae spreading in fruit.
Involucres 7–9(–12) mm; disc florets (10–)12–15(–20); pappus scales oblong to ovate, 1.5–2 mm
Involucres 4–6(–8) mm; disc florets 5–8(–12); pappus scales elliptic or lanceolate to linear-subulate, 2–3+ mm.
Cypselae usually glabrous, sometimes hirtellous and/or gland-dotted.
